===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かん}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かん}} {{m|zh|鼾||snoring}}.

Only found in compounds. Not used in isolation.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|かん}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|かん}}

# [[snoring]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|鼾睡|かんすい}}: to [[sleep]] while [[snoring]]
* {{ja-r|鼾声|かんせい}}: the [[sound]] of [[snoring]], a [[snoring]] [[voice]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いびき}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いびき|息|tr1=i|t1=breath, breathing|引き|tr2=hiki|t2=pulling, drawing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|引く}} ''hiku'' “to pull, to draw”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=いびく|hiki|biki}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いびき|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いびき}}

# [[snoring]], a [[snore]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|空鼾|そらいびき}}: a [[fake]] [[snore]], a snore [[deliberately]] made to make one appear to be [[asleep]]
* {{ja-r|高鼾|たかいびき}}: a [[loud]] [[snore]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Verb====
{{ja-verb-suru|いびき}}

# to [[snore]]

=====Conjugation=====
{{ja-suru|いびき}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|鼾く|いびく}} {{qualifier|rare, probably obsolete}}

=====Usage notes=====
The verb sense “to snore” is more commonly expressed using the verbal phrases {{lang|ja|鼾}}{{m|ja|を}}{{m|ja|掻く|tr=ibiki o kaku|lit=to make a snoring sound}} or {{lang|ja|鼾}}{{m|ja|を}}{{m|ja|立てる|tr=ibiki o tateru|lit=to raise a snore, to put up a snore}}.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|くつち}}
Apparently the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of obsolete verb {{m|ja|鼾つ|tr=kutsutsu||to sleep while snoring|pos=possibly [[onomatopoeic]]}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The {{m|en|epilepsy}} sense may have arisen from how one's breathing may be [[spastic]] and vaguely similar to [[snoring]] when suffering an [[epileptic]] [[seizure]].

However, the conjugation of this [[putative]] verb is unknown, and it is only encountered in what would be the [[nominalize]]d {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of ''kutsuchi''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> This leaves open the possibility of alternative origins:

* May be a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=くつち|口|tr1=kutsu|t1=mouth|pos1=the bound form of modern {{m|ja|口|tr=kuchi}}, only found in compounds|風|tr2=chi|t2=wind|pos2=from the way that snoring often happens when breathing through the mouth, or from the way that an [[epileptic]] [[seizure]] may involve [[spastic]] breathing vaguely similar to snoring}}.
* The {{m|en|epilepsy}} sense may be a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=くつち|口|tr1=kutsu|t1=mouth|pos1=the bound form of modern {{m|ja|口|tr=kuchi}}, only found in compounds|血|tr2=chi|t2=blood|pos2=from the common occurrence of biting one's tongue during an [[epileptic]] [[seizure]]}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|くつち}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|癲狂}}, {{ja-l|癲癇}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くつち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=くつち|archaic|rare}} [[snoring]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=くつち|archaic|rare}} [[epilepsy]]

* {{ja-r|鼾臥す|くつちふす}}: to [[sleep]] while [[snoring]]
{{der-bottom}}
